org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.cache
Class OrganizationCache

java.lang.Object
  org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.cache.OrganizationCache

public class OrganizationCache
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a cache of organizations and ip address ranges

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Method Detail

v4Size

public static int v4Size()
Get the number of v4 address ranges in the map. Used for testing.

Returns:
the size of the v4 map

v6Size

public static int v6Size()
Get the number of v6 address ranges in the map. Used for testing.

Returns:
the size of the v6 map

cache

public static void cache()
Fill the cache with objects. To minimize cache unavailability, this method fills a new cache then exchanges it with the existing cache, then clears the old cache.

queryV4Ranges

public static java.util.List<org.phoenixbioinformatics.paywall.bs.paywall.BsIpV4Range> queryV4Ranges()
Query all the IPv4 ranges.

Returns:
a list of v4 ranges

queryV6Ranges

public static java.util.List<org.phoenixbioinformatics.paywall.bs.paywall.BsIpV6Range> queryV6Ranges()
Query all the IPv6 ranges.

Returns:
a list of v6 ranges

isSubscribed

public static boolean isSubscribed(java.lang.String ipAddress)
Is the input IP address in a currently subscribed range of IP addresses?

Parameters:
ipAddress - the IP address in quad format (123.456.789.012) or IPv6 format (123:456a:...)
Returns:
true if there is an organization with an IP address range that includes the input address

isJndi

public static boolean isJndi()
Should the database access use JNDI?

Returns:
true to use JNDI, false to use JDBC

setJndi

public static void setJndi(boolean jndi)
Specify whether to use JNDI.

Parameters:
jndi - true to use JNDI for database access, false to use JDBC

clearCaches

private static void clearCaches()
Helper method to clear caches for any objects used in building the cache
